statements: To increase public trust in institutions, we should combine strong accountability and transparency with reliable, effective service delivery that people can see in their daily lives. Those who worry about overreach deserve clear limits on power, independent oversight, and consequences for misconduct, while those who value institutional capacity need adequate resources, professional standards, and evidence-based decision-making. Building trust also requires consistent two-way communication and meaningful public input, so policies reflect real community needs and institutions earn legitimacy over time.
